hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr al-Makhzumi al-Qurashi: A Hijazi narrator who transmitted from his father. Muhammad ibn Ishaq narrated from him. He was a brother to Umar and Abd al-Malik. It was also narrated that Ibn Ishaq said: Jacob ibn Utbah narrated to us from al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr from his father, saying: I was standing watching while Uthman was besieged.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Ishaq
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ishaq ibn Yasar al-Asadi al-Madani

narrators.name: al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr
narrators.full_name: al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Harith ibn Hisham al-Makhzumi al-Qurashi

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is known as a mudallis and uses indirect transmission
Al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr has majhul status with limited documentation

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is classified as a mudallis (Category 3) using indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: While Ibn Ishaq is generally accepted as saduq, his mudallis classification means there is potential for tadlis in the chain. However, his use of 'an is generally accepted given his overall reliability as a transmitter of Sirah

potential_issues.issue: Al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr has unclear reliability status
potential_issues.impact: Limited biographical information makes assessment difficult, though his transmission through reliable narrators like Ibn Ishaq suggests he was known

Topics: Biographical entry about al-Harith ibn Abi Bakr al-Makhzumi
Incident of Uthman being besieged by followers
Witness account to historical event

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Thawb al-Asadi: He saw Ali. Abbas ibn Dharih narrated from him. He is counted among the Kufians. Al-Harith ibn Thaqaf: He narrated from al-Hasan. Yahya ibn al-Yaman and Muhammad ibn Yusuf narrated from him according to his statement.

narrators.name: Yahya ibn al-Yaman
narrators.full_name: Yahya ibn al-Yaman ibn Khalid al-Tamimi

narrators.name: al-Harith ibn Thaqaf
narrators.full_name: al-Harith ibn Thaqaf ibn al-Harith

narrators.name: al-Hasan al-Basri
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Abi al-Hasan Yasar al-Basri

chainIssues: Al-Harith ibn Thaqaf has unclear status with only secondary documentation

potential_issues.issue: Al-Harith ibn Thaqaf has majhul status with limited documentation
potential_issues.impact: The reliability of this narrator cannot be clearly established. Only known through the statement of Yahya ibn al-Yaman and Muhammad ibn Yusuf

Topics: Biographical entry about al-Harith ibn Thawb and al-Harith ibn Thaqaf
Transmission from al-Hasan al-Basri

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Juhman, Abu Kathir al-Zubaidi: He said this to me about Ali, and Ibn al-Mubarak said: from Mus'ar that al-Harith ibn Juhman saw Ali. His hadith is among the Kufians. Al-Harith ibn Jamilah from Um al-Darda from Abu al-Darda from the Prophet ﷺ said: Indeed from the heaviest deeds on the Day of Resurrection is good character. Yahya ibn Ayyub and Ja'far ibn Sulayman narrated this from Abdullah ibn Abi Husayn from al-Harith. Al-Harith ibn al-Jarud from al-Harith al-Akli from Ibrahim according to his statement. Abu Awanah narrated from him. His hadith is from the people of Iraq.

narrators.name: Yahya ibn Ayyub
narrators.full_name: Yahya ibn Ayyub ibn Qurrah

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Abi Husayn
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abi Husayn al-Masri

narrators.name: al-Harith ibn Jamilah
narrators.full_name: al-Harith ibn Jamilah

narrators.name: Um al-Darda
narrators.full_name: Um al-Darda al-Sughra bint Abu al-Darda
narrators.alternative_names: Umm al-Darda al-Kubra, Hajjah bint Hajjaj

narrators.name: Abu al-Darda
narrators.full_name: Uwaymir ibn Zayd ibn Qays al-Ansari

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Abdullah ibn Abi Husayn has majhul al-hal status - only known from Yahya ibn Ayyub
Al-Harith ibn Jamilah has majhul status - only one person documented to narrate from him

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Abi Husayn has majhul al-hal status
potential_issues.impact: This is the only known transmitter from this narrator, which affects the reliability assessment. Multiple people narrate from al-Harith, but Abdullah's reliability cannot be verified

potential_issues.issue: Al-Harith ibn Jamilah has majhul status
potential_issues.impact: This narrator appears to be unknown from multiple sources, making the chain weak at this point

Topics: Good character is the heaviest deed on the Day of Resurrection
Virtue of good character and moral conduct
Saying of Abu al-Darda about ethical behavior

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Haramil from Ali. Rijah ibn Hayawah and Jundub narrated from him, and he heard from Ka'b. Al-Harith ibn Habish al-Asadi: Sa'id ibn al-As sent me to Ali according to his statement. Shaqiq ibn Salamah narrated from him. His hadith is from the Kufians. Al-Harith ibn Abi al-Harith from Ali according to his statement. Simak ibn Harb narrated from him. Among the Kufians. Al-Harith ibn Hasairah al-Audi al-Kufi heard Zayd ibn Wahb. Al-Thawri attributed him as such. Al-Harith ibn al-Hakam al-Damari from Abu Amr ibn Hamas, mursal. Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from him. He is counted among the people of Madinah.

narrators.name: Rijah ibn Hayawah
narrators.full_name: Rijah ibn Hayawah ibn Qurash al-Qadasi

narrators.name: al-Harith ibn Haramil
narrators.full_name: al-Harith ibn Haramil

narrators.name: Ali ibn Abi Talib
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Abi Talib ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Al-Harith ibn Haramil has majhul status

potential_issues.issue: Al-Harith ibn Haramil has majhul status
potential_issues.impact: The reliability of this narrator cannot be clearly established. The chain depends heavily on sparse documentation

Topics: Biographical entry about multiple al-Harith narrators from Kufa
Transmission from Ali ibn Abi Talib

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Khuffaf ibn Umayyah ibn Rahdah al-Ghiffari: Abu al-Rabi' narrated to me, saying: Ismail ibn Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Muhammad ibn Amr narrated to us, from Khalid ibn Abdullah ibn Harmilah, from al-Harith ibn Khuffaf, from his father, saying: The Prophet ﷺ bowed. And Yusuf narrated to me, saying: Fadl ibn Musa narrated to us, saying: Inform us Muhammad ibn Amr from Khalid ibn Abdullah ibn Harmilah from al-Harith ibn Khuffaf from Khuffaf. And Musa ibn Ismail narrated to us from Hammad from Muhammad from Khalid from Khuffaf. His hadith is among the people of the Hijaz.

narrators.name: Abu al-Rabi
narrators.full_name: Sulayman ibn Dawood ibn Abd al-Malik al-Qurashi al-Madani

narrators.name: Ismail ibn Ja'far
narrators.full_name: Ismail ibn Ja'far ibn Aban al-Hudhali

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Amr
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Amr ibn Alqamah al-Qurashi al-Madani

narrators.name: Khalid ibn Abdullah ibn Harmilah
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Abdullah ibn Harmilah al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: al-Harith ibn Khuffaf
narrators.full_name: al-Harith ibn Khuffaf ibn Umayyah ibn Rahdah al-Ghiffari

narrators.name: Khuffaf ibn Umayyah
narrators.full_name: Khuffaf ibn Umayyah ibn Rahdah al-Ghiffari

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Amr is known to have suffered from ikhtilat (confusion in later life)
The hadith text only shows the matn as the bowing of the Prophet without context

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Amr suffered from ikhtilat affecting his later narrations
potential_issues.impact: Muhammad ibn Amr is saduq but became confused in later life. Early narrators from him like Shu'bah and al-Thawri are reliable, but later narrators from him should be scrutinized. Khalid ibn Abdullah narrated from him, and Khalid is reliable and early, so this chain is acceptable despite the ikhtilat concern

potential_issues.issue: Limited matn information
potential_issues.impact: Only the phrase 'The Prophet ﷺ bowed' is provided without fuller context

Topics: Description of the Prophet's ﷺ bowing in prayer
Prayer method and posture of the Prophet ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Abi Rabi'ah al-Hijazi: Narrated by Said ibn Jubayr, Mujahid, al-Sha'bi, and al-Zuhri. Qutaybah narrated to us, saying: Jarir narrated to us from Abd al-Aziz ibn Rafi from Ubaydullah ibn al-Qibtiyyah: Al-Harith ibn Abi Rabi'ah and Abdullah ibn Safwan entered upon Um Salamah, and I was with them during the days of Ibn al-Zubair. Amr said to me: Abu Asim narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us. I heard Abdullah ibn Ubayd ibn Umayr and al-Walid ibn Ataa ibn Khabbab narrating from al-Harith ibn Abdullah ibn Abi Rabi'ah that he went as a delegation to Abd al-Malik. He said: I heard Aisha from the Prophet ﷺ regarding the construction of the House. And Ibn Jurayj narrated from Abdullah ibn Abi Umayyah who heard al-Harith ibn Abdullah ibn Abi Rabi'ah saying.

narrators.name: Qutaybah ibn Said
narrators.full_name: Qutaybah ibn Said ibn Jamil al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Jarir ibn Abd al-Hamid
narrators.full_name: Jarir ibn Abd al-Hamid ibn Qubaysah al-Dabbi

narrators.name: Abd al-Aziz ibn Rafi
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Aziz ibn Rafi ibn Abi Rafi al-Madani

narrators.name: Ubaydullah ibn al-Qibtiyyah

narrators.full_name: Hind bint Abi Umayyah ibn al-Mughirah al-Makhzumiyyah
narrators.alternative_names: Ramla bint Abi Sufyan, Um Salamah

chainIssues: Ubaydullah ibn al-Qibtiyyah has awham (mistakes) in his narrations
The transmission involves a mawquf (stopped) hadith from Um Salamah, not a clear marfu chain

potential_issues.issue: Ubaydullah ibn al-Qibtiyyah is classified as Saduq Lahu Awham (prone to mistakes)
potential_issues.impact: While saduq in general, this narrator is known for errors and confusions in specific matters. The chain reliability is compromised at this point

potential_issues.issue: The hadith appears to be a complex incident with multiple narration paths mixed together
potential_issues.impact: The text shows overlap of multiple transmission paths about al-Harith ibn Abi Rabi'ah, making it difficult to establish a single clear chain

Topics: Incident of the delegation visiting Um Salamah during the time of Ibn al-Zubair
Narration about the construction of the Kaaba
Historical account of al-Harith ibn Abi Rabi'ah's delegation to Abd al-Malik

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Suwayd, Abu Aisha al-Taymi al-Kufi, from Ibn Mas'ud. Waqi' attributed him, and Ali gave me his kunya. From Jarir ibn Abi Hayyan. Abdullah ibn Abi Shayba al-Absi said: Muhammad ibn Ubayd narrated to us from al-A'mash from Ibrahim al-Taymi, he said: Indeed if a man from the tribe would come to al-Harith ibn Suwayd and abuse him, he would be silent and enter. Al-Harith ibn Sa'd ibn Abi Dhabab al-Dusi al-Hijazi: Umar sent him as a tax collector. He heard Abu Hurayrah. Yazid ibn Harmuz narrated from him.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Ubayd
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ubayd al-Qurashi

narrators.name: al-A'mash
narrators.full_name: Sulayman ibn Mihran al-A'mash al-Kufi

chainIssues: Al-A'mash is a known mudallis but uses indirect transmission (عَنْ)
Al-Harith ibn Suwayd has majhul status
This is a biographical entry, not a complete narration

potential_issues.issue: Al-A'mash is classified as a mudallis (Category 2) using indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: While al-A'mash is reliable even with 'an, the mudallis classification means there is potential for concealment in the chain. However, his reliability is generally accepted

potential_issues.issue: Al-Harith ibn Suwayd has majhul status
potential_issues.impact: This narrator's reliability cannot be clearly established from available sources

Topics: Biographical entry about al-Harith ibn Suwayd al-Taymi

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Shubail ibn Awf al-Bajali: It is said he was the brother of al-Mughirah ibn Shubail and it is said he was the son of Shabl, from Abdullah ibn Shaddad.

narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Shaddad al-Laythi

hadiths.english_translation: Musaddad said to me: Yahya narrated to us from Ismail ibn Abi Khalid from al-Harith ibn Shubail from Abu Amr al-Shaybani from Zayd ibn Arqam, he said: We used to speak during the time of the Prophet ﷺ in the prayer until there was revealed: 'and stand before God with obedience.' So he commanded us with silence.

hadiths.english_translation: Ali said to me: Safwan ibn Isa narrated to us, he said: Inform me al-Harith ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Dhabab, he said: Inform me Munir ibn Abdullah from his father from Said ibn Abi Dhabab: I came to the Prophet ﷺ and accepted Islam, then Abu Bakr appointed me, then Umar.

Topics: Incident of Said ibn Abi Dhabab coming to the Prophet ﷺ and accepting Islam
Appointment of Said by Abu Bakr and then Umar
Historical account of a Companion's conversion and roles in early Islamic government

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Salt ibn Muhammad said to me: Anas ibn Iyad narrated to us, he said: Al-Harith ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Dhabab narrated to us from Munir ibn Abdullah from his father from Sa'd, and he was from the people of al-Sarah, similar to it: I spoke to my people about honey, then I came to Umar, so he placed its price in the charitable giving of the Muslims.

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Laqit al-Nakha'i: He witnessed Umar. He witnessed al-Qadisiyyah. He is counted among the Kufians. Abu Nu'aym said to us: From Hanash from his father from Ali in the cave, and some did not raise it.

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Nufail: From Aisha. Abu Mujliz and his son Abdullah al-Hashimi narrated from him. Hajjaj narrated to us, he said: Hammad narrated to us, he said: Hammad narrated to us from Ammar ibn Abi Ammar from Abdullah.

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Wahb: From al-Sunabih from the Prophet ﷺ, mursal. Al-Salt ibn Bahram narrated from him. His hadith is from the Kufians. Al-Harith, the father of Malik: He heard Abu Musa.
